page.title: 09MARCHWIEL CRICKET CLUB
page.content: MARCHWIEL CRICKET CLUB IS SITUATED ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF MARCHWIEL. THE CLUB IS LONG ESTABLISHED AND IS LOCATED NEXT TO MARCHWIEL HALL,WHERE THE WOODS OF THE HALL SURROUND THE CLUB. THE OWNER OF THE CLUB IS MR JOHN BELL WHO HAS TAKEN THE CLUB TO LORDS MANY TIMES. THE TEAM HOLDS A CRICKET CLUB FOR YOUNG PEOPLE TO COME AND LEARN THE GAME. THE GROUND IS VERY BIG THE CLUB BUILDING IS VERY OLD AND SMALL TO NORMAL SIZE GROUNDS. WHEN THEY WON THE WHITBREAD VILLAGE NATIONAL CUP THEY CELEBRATED BY A TOUR OF THE VILLAGE SHOWING THE CUP. THE CLUB HAS PUT MARCHWIEL ON THE MAP. THEY HAVE WON THE CUP TWICE. THE CRICKET TEAM TENDS TO CONCENTRATE ON THE WHITBREAD VILLAGE NATIONAL CUP, THEREFORE THE LEAGUE IS OF SECONDARY IMPORTANCE.
